data.title: “Americans Don’t Know How Capitalist China Is”
data.meta_description: Weijian Shan was born in China and had his life upended by the Cultural Revolution. Educated in the United States, he worked for the World Bank and J.P. Morgan and taught at the Wharton School. Today he is the CEO of PAG, a $40 billion private equity firm based in Hong Kong. In this interview he talks about the accessibility of the Chinese market, America’s demonization of China, what the Chinese don’t understand about the U.S., and more. The complete Spotlight package is available in a single reprint.
data.text:
Weijian Shan was born in China and had his life upended by the Cultural Revolution. Educated in the United States, he worked for the World Bank and J.P. Morgan and taught at the Wharton School. Today he is the CEO of PAG, a $40 billion private equity firm based in Hong Kong. In this interview he talks about the accessibility of the Chinese market, America’s demonization of China, what the Chinese don’t understand about the U.S., and more.

The complete Spotlight package is available in a single reprint.
